meanings.sent1: During the ceremony, they eulogise the hero for his bravery.
meanings.sent2: People often eulogise their loved ones at funerals.
meanings.sent3: The children eulogised their pet goldfish by giving it a grand farewell.
meanings.sent4: She eulogised the sunset as a painting in the sky.
meanings.sent5: The teacher eulogised the student's hard work and dedication in front of the class.

meanings.definition: To speak or write in praise of.
meanings.sent1: The author eulogised the beauty of nature in his latest book.
meanings.sent2: Fans eulogise their favorite celebrities on social media.
meanings.sent3: The chef eulogised the delicious flavors of the new dish he created.
meanings.sent4: She eulogised her best friend as the most loyal companion she ever had.
meanings.sent5: The artist eulogised the historical significance of the ancient ruins in his painting.
